prompt.p: Vitamin B 12 deficiency can lead to neuropathy.
What is a consequence of vitamin B 12 deficiency?

choiceInteraction.simpleChoice: Neural tube defects in a fetus
Subacute degeneration of the spinal cord

modalFeedback.p:
Option C (Subacute degeneration of the spinal cord) is Correct. Vitamin B 12 deficiency leads to subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord, and folate deficiency leads to neural tube defects in a fetus.
Option A (Neural tube defects in a fetus) is Incorrect. Folic acid deficiency leads to neural tube defects in a fetus.
Option B (Optic neuritis) is Incorrect. Optic neuritis is seen in multiple sclerosis and diabetes, among other conditions.
Option D (Subsclerosing panencephalitis) is Incorrect. Subsclerosing panencephalitis is a consequence of measles.
Option E (Wernicke's encephalopathy) is Incorrect. Wernicke's encephalopathy is a deficiency in thiamine (vitamin B 1 ) often seen in chronic alcohol abuse.
